intel.title:
Silver Alert
Severity: Extreme, Certainty: Observed

Tornado Warning issued May 19 at 2:30PM CDT until May 19 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
Severity: Extreme, Certainty: Observed
intel.content:
TOROUN

The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Southeastern Clay County in northern Texas...

* Until 300 PM CDT.

* At 229 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located 4 miles east of Bluegrove, moving northeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of
southeastern Clay County.

TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior
room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you
are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest
substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.

AND BULCHER.

intel.title:
Severe Storm Warning Seek Shelter Immediately
Severity: Extreme, Certainty: Observed
intel.content:
If in previous path of May 16 tornado, we strongly encourage you to evacuate due to severe weather which poses a higher risk due to previous damage. Evacuation orders will start at 6 PM through 11 PM for the tornado path area. Shelters are ready to accept you. If you need transportation or other assistance, please call the following emergency number at 606-878-7000.1.Shelters: 1, London Community Center, 529 S. Main Street, London, KY, 2. First Baptist Church of London, 804 W 5th Street, London, KY, 3. West London Baptist Church, 360 Parker Road, London, KY.
Shelter Now. If you need transportation or other assistance, please call the following emergency number at 606-878-7000.

intel.title: Officials alert possible measles exposure for anyone who attended Shakira's Thursday show at MetLife
intel.content: Officials from the New Jersey Health Department have issued an alert regarding possible measles exposure at Shakira's MetLife concert on May 16. The warning comes after a non-New Jersey resident attended the concert and was infected with the disease. Officials are urging individuals, including parents, health care providers and caregivers, to be aware of the symptoms and to stay up to date with the measles, mumps and rubella shots. The Department of Health recommends that anyone exposed to the virus should contact a health care provider before going to any medical office or emergency department. If infected, symptoms could begin as late as June 6.
intel.summary: New Jersey officials warn of possible measles exposure at Shakira's MetLife concert, urging awareness and reminder of the symptoms until late June.

intel.title: Newark, New Jersey’s Aviation Challenges Spotlight Urgent Need for Innovation to Drive Tourism Growth in the New York Metro Area
intel.content: Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR) has experienced its fourth air traffic control (ATC) outage in a few weeks, highlighting the need for innovation to drive tourism growth in the New York Metro Area. The disruption, which can impact tourism, regional economies, and the traveler experience can dampen visitor confidence and stimulate tourism growth. The aging technology and staffing shortages at Newark's Philadelphia ATC center exacerbates delays and operational risks. The Department of Transportation has proposed a comprehensive modernization plan to replace outdated air traffic systems and address staffing gaps. The plan is supported by the President's proposed infrastructure funding bill and aims to invest tens of billions of dollars to build a safer, smarter, and more efficient aviation network. The modernization plan will support sustainable growth by enabling more efficient routing and fuel savings, and enhance the U.S. position as a premier travel destination with cutting-edge infrastructure.
intel.summary: Newark Liberty International Airport faces urgent needs of modern aviation infrastructure to boost tourism, regional economies, and enhance passenger experiences due to persistent ATC issues.

intel.title: Consumer Alert: Governor Hochul Warns New Yorkers to Be Aware of NBA Ticket Scams
intel.content: New York Governor Kathy Hochul has issued a consumer alert to basketball fans looking to purchase tickets to an NBA Eastern Conference Final game, urging them to be aware of potential scams. The New York Knicks have reached the Eastern Conference finals for the first time in 25 years, and this is an opportunity for scammers to exploit high demand for tickets. Governor Hochuls urges consumers to follow these tips from the New York Department of State’s Division of Consumer Protection. The tips include avoiding ticket scams, buying tickets from trusted sources, avoiding online marketplaces like Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, and other social media sites, and avoiding ticket scalpers outside the event gates. Paying with a credit card rather than traditional credit card, or using any untraceable payment methods, is considered a fraud protection method.
intel.summary: Governor Kathy Hochul warns New Yorkers about potential NBA Eastern Conference Final ticket scams, urging caution and trusted sources like Craigslist and other online marketplaces to protect against scammers.

intel.title: Consumer Alert: Governor Hochul Warns New Yorkers To Be Aware Of NBA Ticket Scams
intel.content: New York Governor Kathy Hochul has issued a consumer alert to basketball fans looking to purchase tickets to an NBA Eastern Conference Final game, urging them to be aware of potential scams. The New York Knicks have reached the Eastern Conference finals for the first time in 25 years, and this is an opportunity for scammers to exploit high demand for tickets. Governor Hochuls urges consumers to follow these tips provided by the New York Department of State’s Division of Consumer Protection to avoid ticket ticket scams. Consumers should only purchase tickets from trusted sources and avoid online marketplaces like Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, and other social media sites for fraudulent tickets. They should also be wary of ticket scalpers who approach them outside the event gates and avoid resellers who sell fake tickets. The National Association of Ticketkers member resales requires their member companies to ensure that every ticket sold on their websites is sold at a minimum of low prices. Pay only credit cards, which offer more fraud protection than traditional credit cards.
intel.summary: Governor Kathy Hochul warns New Yorkers about potential NBA Eastern Conference Final ticket scams, urging caution and trusted sources like Craigslist and other online marketplaces to protect against scammers.

intel.title: Measles exposure alert issued for Shakira concert at MetLife Stadium, NJ health officials say
intel.content: The New Jersey Department of Health has issued an exposure alert for a Shakira concert at MetLife Stadium, potentially exposing tens of thousands of concertgoers to measles. The department stated that a non-NJ resident recently diagnosed with the virus attended the concert. There have been no confirmed measles cases from the concert so far. Health officials warned that anyone exposed to measles could develop symptoms as late as June 6. The virus spreads through the air and can linger in a space for up to two hours after an infected person leaves. The two-dose vaccine is safe and remains the most effective protection against the virus.
intel.summary: New Jersey health officials issued a measles exposure alert for tens of thousands of concertgoers at Shakira’s MetLife Stadium on May 15.

intel.title: Road work this weeks News Online
intel.content: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation is working on several busy roads this week, including Buck Mountain between Laurel Street and Quakake Road, a road closure for paving and a detour. Other road closures include Whitehall Township, Route 329 between Northampton County Line and Route 873, Allentown, Tilghman Street between Route 100 and Airport Road, and Cedar Crest Boulevard between Route 22 and Mauch Chunk Road. Tunkhannock Township, Interstate 80 pothole patching between New Jersey State Line and Exit 293 (Interstate 380), and multiple municipalities, will also be affected by road work. The work is expected to occur throughout the week.
intel.summary: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation announced road work this week, including paving for Buck Mountain, bridge repair, and pothole patches for multiple municipalities.

intel.title: Fantasy Baseball Injury News and Updates
intel.content: Toronto Blue Jays outfielder/designated hitter Anthony Santander is serving as the DH for the Jays and will hit sixth in the batting order against the San Diego Padres and right-hander Dylan Cease in the series opener. Santander, who had a career year as a first-time All-Star in 2024 with Baltimore, is currently slating just.182/.264/.308 with five homers, 16 RBI and a 44:18 K:BB in his first 41 games with the Blue Jays. New York Yankees outfielder Jasson Dominguez is given a day off against the Texas Rangers. Washington Nationals outfielder Jacob Young will miss his second consecutive game due to a left-shoulder injury, but could be back for Wednesday's game against Atlanta Braves. The games between the Cleveland Guardians and Minnesota Twins have been postponed due to rain.
intel.summary: Toronto Blue Jays' Anthony Santander will hit sixth against San Diego Padres, while Washington Nationals' Jacob Young is out for a second game.

intel.title: Upper West Side Child Reported Missing for At Least Third Time - iLovetheUpperWestSide
intel.content: The NYPD has issued an alert about 16-year-old Andrew Ahtay, a Hispanic male from the Upper West Side, who has been missing for over two weeks. Ahatay was last seen leaving his residence on May 5, 2025, at approximately 7:10 a.m. and is described as having a thin build, a medium complexion, brown eyes, and black hair. This is not the first time AHTay has been reported missing; he was also reported missing in January 2020 and September 2020 at the age of 10 and 11 respectively. Anyone with information should contact the NYPD’s Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477) or for Spanish at 1888-57-PISTA (74782).
intel.summary: The NYPD has issued a missing Upper West Side teenager, 16-year-old Andrew Ahtay, from 210 West 64th Street, with potential kidnappers and potential victims.

intel.title: Child On Bike Hit By Car At Busy Monsey Intersection Long Deemed Unsafe: Report
intel.content: A child on a bike was hit by a car at a busy intersection in Monsey, New York, on May 20. The collision occurred at the intersection of College Road and Smolley Drive, which has been deemed unsafe by residents. The child sustained serious but non-life-threatening injuries and was transported to a nearby hospital for treatment. Emergency responders were able to save the child. Residents have urged Rockland County officials to install a crosswalk at the busy intersection, which sees frequent pedestrian and bicycle traffic.
intel.summary: A three-year-old boy was seriously injured when he was hit by a car at a busy Monsey Intersection, prompting calls for safety improvements.

intel.title: Belleville alerts residents to water main break
intel.content: Belleville, New Jersey, has issued a warning about a water main break that may impact residents on Arthur, Center and Charles streets. The township may see little to no water pressure due to the break, and the Department of Public Works is working to repair the break. The initial draft of this story was reviewed and edited by NJ Advance Media staff.
intel.summary: Belleville alerts residents to a water main break on Arthur Street, causing little to no pressure, with crews working to repair the damaged property.

intel.title: West River Rabies Alert
intel.content: The Anne Arundel County Department of Health is seeking anyone who may have come in contact with a raccoon in West River, Maryland, who tested positive for rabies. If you or your pet had contact with the infected animal, or any pet has unexplained wounds, please contact the department at 410-222-7254 or 443-481-3140. Rabies is spread when an infected animal bites or scratches another person or another animal. Preventive treatment may be required for anyone who handled, fed, or was attacked by the infected creature. The Department of Heath advises county residents to take several measures to prevent the spread of rabies, including current rabies immunizations for pets and outside garbage in covered containers to avoid attracting wild animals.
intel.summary: The Anne Arundel County Department of Health is seeking information after a raccoon tested positive for rabies, urging public safety and effective preventive measures.

intel.title: Rabid Raccoon Found In Anne Arundel County: Health Officials Issue Urgent Warning
intel.content: The Anne Arundel County Department of Health has issued an urgent warning regarding a raccoon found on Muddy Creek Road in West River, which tested positive for rabies. The warning was issued to anyone who came in contact with the animal or has unexplained wounds, or has contact with it immediately. The Department has provided a list of steps for residents to protect themselves and their pets, including avoiding wild animals and seeking medical attention if bitten or scratched by a wild animal. If you or your pet is showing signs of exposure, call the Health Department at 410-222-7254 or 443-481-3140 during business hours or after hours.
intel.summary: The Anne Arundel County Department of Health issued an urgent warning after a raccoon tested positive for rabies, urging public safety measures and urgent medical attention.

intel.title: Onondaga Co. Emergency Complex renamed to honor Lt. Michael Hoosock
intel.content: Onondaga County Legislators have renamed the Emergency Management Complex in honor of Lt. Michael Hoosock, who was shot and killed during a traffic stop in 2024. The resolution was passed by Ononda County Legislator Mark Olson (R, 10), who praised Lt. Haosock's dedication to the community and 17-year veteran of the Sheriff's Office. Both officers have been added to the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial in Washington.
intel.summary: The Onondaga County Emergency Management Complex was renamed the Lt. Michael Hoosock Emergency Complex due to his service and memorialization.

intel.title: Rabies alert issued for Anne Arundel County over infected raccoon
intel.content: The Anne Arundel County Department of Health has issued a rabies alert for pet owners in West River, Maryland. The alert is asking for anyone who may have come in contact with a raccoon that tested positive for rabies. If you or your pet have any contact with the infected animal, contact the Anne Arugndel Department of Heath at 410-222-7254. Other steps to prevent the spread of rabies include current rabies immunizations for pets and avoiding contact with wildlife, especially feral cats, raccoons, bats, and foxes. If bitten or scratched by a suspected rabid animal, immediately wash the wound immediately.
intel.summary: The Anne Arundel County Department of Health issued a rabies alert after a raccoon tested positive, urging pet owners to follow basic safety guidelines.

intel.title: Maryland Weather Alert: Showers and Thunderstorms Hit Baltimore Wednesday With Gusts Up to 22 MPH
intel.content: Showers and possible thunderstorms are expected to hit Baltimore on Wednesday, with wind gusts up to 22 mph expected during the afternoon commute. Rain chances increase after 8 a.m. with near-certain precipitation expected by midday. Gusty southeast winds will accompany the storms, which could cause significant rainfall. Travel on I-95, I-83, and Route 40 may slow due to low visibility and pooling water. The National Weather Service also noted that a thunderstorm may develop before 8 p.m., resulting in locally heavy rainfall. The rest of the week is expected to be mostly sunny and mild, with temperatures reaching 75°F.
intel.summary: Showers and possible thunderstorms will rain and wind gusts up to 22 mph in Baltimore, with severe weather expected to hit the city during the afternoon commute.

intel.title: Washington DC Shooting: Man Shot Near Spingarn High School On Benning Road NE
intel.content: A shooting occurred near the closed campus of Spingarn High School in Washington, DC, at around 1:56 PM. One man was found unconscious and not breathing and pronounced dead at the scene, while another person sustained a hand injury. The shooting also occurred near Charles Young Elementary School. All students are safe and accounted for, and as a precaution, Phelps High School, JO Wilson Elementary, and Browne Education Campus were placed on alert status. The motive for the shooting remains unclear.
intel.summary: A man was killed and another injured in a shooting near Spingarn High School on Benning Road NE, with authorities seeking a gray Honda Accord.

intel.title: The Tipping Point: A Nation in Protest
intel.content: Demonstrations against President Donald Trump are increasing in size and location, with over 100,000 demonstrators gathered in Washington, D.C. on April 5 as part of the largest nationwide protest yet of Trump's second term. The "Hands Off" protest, which was held in the National Mall, was part of over 1,400 nationwide protests, with future protests also planned. The demonstrators were protesting against proposed Medicaid and Medicare cuts, transgender rights rollbacks, DEI program reversals, campus speech restrictions, mass deportation efforts, and trade policy changes. Some protesters believe the demonstration is a warning of what is expected in the second term of Trump’s second term, with concerns about the systematic dismantling of democratic values.
intel.summary: A nation is gripped by protests against President Donald Trump's policies, particularly healthcare cuts and transgender rights, highlighting his disregard for democratic values.

intel.title: Police investigate shooting near elementary school in NE DC
intel.content: A man was shot near an active elementary school and a closed high school campus in Northeast D.C. Police are investigating the incident, which occurred in the 800 block of 26th Street NE near Charles Young Elementary School and the former Spingarn High School. All students are accounted for and the area has been secured as police investigate the circumstances surrounding the shooting. It is unclear what led to the shooting and no suspect information has been released.
intel.summary: D.C.Police are investigating a man's shooting near an active elementary school and a closed high school campus in Northeast DC, where all students are safe and accounted for.

intel.title: Police investigate shooting near school in NE DC
intel.content: A man was shot near a school in Northeast D.C. on Tuesday afternoon, near Charles Young Elementary School and the former Spingarn High School. All students are safe and accounted for, while the police are investigating the incident. The shooting occurred in the 800 block of 26th Street NE. The area has been secured as police investigate the circumstances surrounding the gunfire. It is unclear what led to the shooting.
intel.summary: D.C. Police are investigating a shooting near Charles Young Elementary and Spingarn High School, where a man was found unconscious and not breathing.

intel.title: Persaud Pulls Hotel Project - Beach Talk Radio News
intel.content: After a 3-hour presentation and public hearing, Times Square property owner Terry Persaud pulled his 30-room hotel proposal off the table at the last minute. This decision came after Persaud's original proposal for a 50-unit hotel was rejected in a 7-0 vote by the Los Angeles Property Association (LPA). Despite removing one floor and 20 rooms from the original proposal, Persaud was met with resistance from the Town Council, who were unimpressed with the public benefit he offered and were critical about the size of the project on.5 acres of property. The mayor, Dan Allers, and vice Mayor Jim Attorholt both supported the Mayor's proposal to deny.
intel.summary: Terry Persaud unexpectedly withdrew a 30-room hotel proposal from the Fort Myers Beach Town Council after the LPA rejected his original proposal, leading to a last-minute withdrawal.

intel.title: Montgomery County, MD – Multiple Injured in Three-Vehicle Crash at Shady Grove Rd & Mill Run Dr
intel.content: A three-vehicle crash in Montgomery County, MD, left multiple individuals injured at the intersection of Shady Grove Rd and Mill Run Dr. The crash occurred just before 9:30 a.m. and led to a significant emergency response from Montgomery County Fire and EMS. Local Accident Reports connects crash victims with trusted resources and legal support for recovery.

intel.title: Yankees 5, Rangers 2: Good news and great news as Will Warren leads Yanks with another masterpiece
intel.content: The New York Yankees defeated the Texas Rangers 5-2 in a spring game at Yankee Stadium. The game was marked by two home runs from Aaron Judge and Ben Rice, with Will Warren leading the scoring with a 5.2 innings pitch, 10 strikeouts, no runs. Warren's performance was attributed to his maturity beyond his years on the pitch and evolution. Over his last three starts, he has given up just three earned runs and has struck out 26 batters in 18 innings. The Yankees' bullpen also improved, with the team's overall score standing at 28-19. The win shows the team is finding their rhythm and the Bronx is starting to believe in its future.
intel.summary: The New York Yankees defeated the Texas Rangers 5-2, highlighted by Will Warren's impressive performance, while Aaron Judge and Ben Rice's impressive performances continued.

intel.title: PARK ALERT: Tree still down on Lincoln Park beach path
intel.content: A tree has fallen over Lincoln Park’s north beach path, blocking the path of the path for bicycles, strollers, and wheelchairs. The incident was first reported to the Seattle Parks on Monday evening, but has not yet been cleared. If on foot, you can step over it but not easily navigate it for bicycles or strollers. Seattle Parks has yet to respond to inquiries about clearing the tree.
intel.summary: A tree down in Lincoln Park’s north beach path still hasn’t been cleared, causing a temporary setback for pedestrians and cyclists.

intel.title: BAM Announces Full Festival Details for DanceAfrica 2025, Featuring Mozambique: Movement! Magic! Manifestation! - Latest News, Breaking News, National News, World News, Haiti News - Journal Haiti Progres
intel.content: DanceAfrica, the nation's largest festival of African dance and culture, is set to return for its 48th year with performances, films, dance classes, and community events over Memorial Day weekend. The festival will include Mozambique: Movement! Magic! Manifestation!, a headline dance performance series at the BAM Howard Gilman Opera House, running May 23–26. This year's performance will be under the artistic direction of Abdel R. Salaam and features traditional works by Mozambican artists, including the annual Memorial Tribute to the Ancestors. Other events include a new visual arts installation by Mozamican artist Cassi Namoda and a selection of films from the African Film Festival. DanceAfrica 2025 will also offer experiences in dance classes and film screenings, art, and cultural exchange in community.
intel.summary: DanceAfrica 2025 features Mozambique: Movement! Magic! Manifestation, featuring traditional dances, films, and community events, celebrating its 48th anniversary.

intel.title: Residents demand action after teens cause chaos in Navy Yard
intel.content: Navy Yard residents and local leaders are calling for a curfew after another night of chaos involving large groups of teenagers led to fights, assaults and robberies in the Southeast D.C. neighborhood. During a community meeting, residents expressed fear, frustration, and a growing sense of urgency. Many are pushing for a mandatory curfew in the area. Advisory Neighborhood Commissioner Markita Bryant and others have proposed revising the current D., which already allows for weekend curfew hours for teenagers. While some blame the teens themselves, others point to systemic issues and lack of support.
intel.summary: Navy Yard residents and local leaders demand a curfew after multiple violent clashes and robberies, citing systemic issues and inadequate support.

intel.title: Officials alert possible measles exposure for anyone who attended Shakira's Thursday show at MetLife
intel.content: Officials from New Jersey have issued a warning about possible measles exposure at Shakira's MetLife concert on May 16. The New Jersey Health Department has stated that anyone who attended the concert could have been exposed to measles. Officials believe a non-New Jersey resident attending the concert was infected with the disease. They are urging individuals, including parents, health care providers and caregivers, to be aware of the symptoms and to be up to date with the measles, mumps and rubella shots. If infected, symptoms could begin as late as June 6. The Department of Health recommends that anyone exposed to the virus should contact a health care provider before going to any medical office or emergency department.
intel.summary: Officials warn of possible measles exposure at Shakira's MetLife concert on Thursday, urging awareness and reminder of the symptoms until late June.

intel.title: Shakira concertgoers issued with urgent health warning in New Jersey
intel.content: Shakira concert attendees in New Jersey could have been exposed to measles, according to the New Jersey Health Department (NJDOH). The alert was issued following a newly identified case of measles in a non-NJ resident who attended the concert. No cases have been confirmed related to the concert, but officials warned that infected people could develop symptoms as late as June 6. The CDC confirmed a total of 1,024 measles cases across 31 U.S. states as of last week, three people have died from the disease. The outbreak comes amid questions about Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr's handling of the recent epidemic and his personal views about vaccines.
intel.summary: Shakira concertgoers in New Jersey were warned about possible measles exposure, amid ongoing concerns over vaccine safety and vaccine cuts.

intel.title: There is a measles alert for Shakira fans at MetLife show
intel.content: The New Jersey Department of Health has issued a public alert for anyone who attended the Shakira concert at MetLife Stadium on May 16. They say a non-Jersey resident who attended that event was infected with measles. If exposed, symptoms could develop as late as June 6. State health officials are urging all parties to be aware of the highly contagious virus's symptoms and be up to date with their measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) shots. No other measles cases have been identified in New Jersey so far.
intel.summary: The New Jersey Department of Health issues a measles alert for Shakira fans who attended a MetLife show on May 16, urging awareness of the highly contagious virus.

intel.title: New Jersey Health Dept Issues Measles Alert After Concert
intel.content: New Jersey's Department of Health has issued an alert after a fan from out of state who may have been exposed to measles at a Shakira concert at MetLife Stadium on May 15th may have spread the highly contagious virus. The event was held outside and the venue is large, with a capacity of 85,000 people. Despite this, health officials have stated that there have been no measles cases associated with the concert yet, symptoms could develop as late as June 6. The department advises anyone attending the concert to monitor for symptoms such as high fever, cough, runny nose, and a rash. Additionally, make sure your measles, mumps, and rubella vaccinations are up to date.
intel.summary: New Jersey Health officials warn that a fan from out of state may have spread measles during a Shakira concert, with symptoms potentially developing later.

intel.title: CBS News correspondent Weijia Jiang's daughter asks question at White House
Health Alert After Shakira’s Concert in the U.S.
intel.content: The New Jersey Department of Health (NJDOH) has issued a measles exposure advisory after an infected individual attended Shakira's concert at MetLife Stadium on May 15 and 16, 2025. The confirmed case involved a non-resident of the state, but the risk of virus transmission remains significant. Anyone unvaccinated or having never had measles could develop symptoms between now and June 6. The warning aligns with a national trend of measles cases returning in the US, partly due to declining vaccination rates. Over 160 cases have been reported in at least 17 states so far in 2025, surpassing recent annual figures.
intel.summary: A measles case at Shakira’s concert in New Jersey prompted a public health alert, urging public health vigilance and increased vaccination coverage.

intel.title: $HAREHOLDER ALERT: The M&A Class Action Firm Investigates the Merger of SigmaTron International, Inc. – SGMA
intel.content: The M&A Class Action Firm, Monteverde & Associates PC, is investigating the proposed merger of SigmaTron International, Inc. (NASDAQ: SGMA) with Transom Capital Group, LLC. The firm, which has recovered millions of dollars for shareholders and is ranked as a Top 50 Firm in the 2024 ISS Securities Class Action Services Report, is headquartered at the Empire State Building in New York City. If you own common stock in the listed company, please visit the firm for free information. Not all law firms are the same and should you hire a lawyer before hiring them.

intel.title: Massive fire guts historic $8.6 million mansion near Obama’s home in Washington DC
intel.content: A massive fire broke out at a historic $8.6 million mansion in Washington, DC's Kalorama neighborhood early Tuesday morning, leading to large-scale evacuations and a major emergency response. The three-story English manor-style house was reportedly under renovation and located near the home of Barack Obama. The fire started around 6 am on the 2400 block of Kalorama Road, just hours after firefighters had put out a smaller fire at the same home the previous night. About 125 firefighters and 30 units were called in to fight the blaze. During the response, one firefighter fell into an elevator shaft, triggering a mayday alert, and was taken to the hospital as a precaution.
intel.summary: A massive fire at an historic mansion in Washington DC, prompting evacuations and major emergency response, was caused by an electrical issue.

intel.title: Tractor-trailer crash, fuel leak causes major delays on I-95 in Stafford County
intel.content: A tractor-trailer crash in Stafford County has caused major delays on I-95, shutting down all lanes due to a fuel leak. The Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT) issued a traffic alert at 10:30 a.m. The collision occurred at mile 142, near Exit 140, Courthouse Road. All traffic was diverted off the interstate at Exit 140 and the on-ramp for this exit was closed. No one was injured in the crash. The timing of traffic signals is being adjusted along Route 1 to help alleviate congestion.
intel.summary: A tractor-trailer crash in Stafford County caused major delays on I-95, with traffic diverted to Exit 140 and fuel leaking from the vehicle.

intel.title: Wyckoff Avenue closed southbound for emergency water work until 3 p.m.
intel.content: Ridgewood Water in New Jersey has announced an emergency southbound closure of Wyckoff Avenue at Franklin Avenue for utility work, expected to last until approximately 3 p.m. The closure is necessary to allow contractors to perform urgent maintenance on infrastructure in the area. Residents and businesses within the closed section will still be allowed access. Drivers are advised to expect detours and traffic delays throughout the area, and are urged to allow additional time for travel.
intel.summary: Ridgewood Water has closed Wyckoff Avenue southbound for emergency utility work, causing detours and traffic delays until 3.m.

intel.title: 12-year-old boy vanishes in Suitland, police issue missing person alert
intel.content: Makhi Jefferson, a 12-year-old boy from Suitland, Maryland, was reported missing on May 19 and has not been seen or heard from since. The Prince George’s County Police Department is actively searching for him. He is described as a Black male, standing 5 feet 4 inches tall and weighing about 120 pounds. At the time of his disappearance, he was wearing a black sweater, black pants, and carrying a multi-colored book bag. Police are urging the public to come forward with any information.
intel.summary: The Prince George's County Police Department is searching for 12-year-old Makhi Jefferson, who disappeared from Suitland, Maryland, on May 19.

intel.title: Weather Alert: Coastal Flood Advisory issued for Alexandria
intel.content: A Coastal Flood Advisory is in effect for Alexandria from 2 p.m. Wednesday (May 21) to 6 a.m., with high tides expected to rise up to two and a half feet above normal levels. The National Weather Service in Baltimore/Washington has issued the advisory, warning that low-lying areas could see water up to one foot above ground level. This advisory also covers Washington, D.C., and Arlington County. High tide in Alexandria is expected for 3:41 p., 41 a. m. Wednesday and 4:16 a.M. Thursday, these times align with when flooding risk is highest.
intel.summary: A Coastal Flood Advisory is in effect for Alexandria, with high tides expected to push low-lying areas closer to the curb.

intel.title: NJ Issues Measles Exposure Alert for MetLife Concert
intel.content: The New Jersey Department of Health (NJDOH) has issued a public health alert regarding potential exposure to measles after a non-resident infected attended a concert at MetLife Stadium on May 15. The event took place from 7:30 p.m. on May 16 and may have exposed attendees. The alert advises individuals who were at the stadium to monitor for symptoms of measles through June 6, 2025. No additional measles cases have been confirmed in New Jersey related to the event. The department has urged residents to remain current on vaccinations, particularly the measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine, which is considered safe and effective. For those traveling internationally, full vaccination is strongly recommended.
intel.summary: New Jersey's Department of Health issues a measles exposure alert for a MetLife Stadium concert on May 15, urging MMR vaccination and proper medical care.

intel.title: UPDATE: Medical Emergency May Have Caused Fatal Leonardtown Crash, Police Say
intel.content: On May 21, 2025, a serious motor vehicle collision with entrapment occurred in Leonardtown, Maryland. The St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office responded to the scene of Point Lookout Road (MD Route 5) and St. Margarets Drive. The collision involved a 2017 Chevrolet Silverado, driven by Charles Lathem, who crossed the center line and hit a southbound 2011 Ford Econoline van head-on. Lathem was transported by helicopter to a regional trauma center for treatment. The driver of the van was pronounced dead at the scene. A medical emergency is believed to be a contributing factor in the collision.
intel.summary: A medical emergency may have caused a fatal collision involving a Chevrolet Silverado on Point Lookout Road in Leonardtown, Maryland, on Wednesday.

intel.title: Theatre News: Pride Plays 2025 at Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company
intel.content: Pride Plays 2025 will be held at Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company in Washington, D.C. partnering with Rattlestick Theater in association with Woolly. The festival will celebrate the rich tapestry of LGBTQIA+ experiences through live theater. Performers include Larry Kramer's The Normal Heart, directed by Zhailon Levingston, Sylvian Oswald’s PONY and Will Davis. Tickets are free and open to the public and available now at woollymammoth.org.
intel.summary: Pride Plays 2025, partnering with Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company, will open in Washington, D.C during WorldPride 2025, featuring performances including Larry Kramer’s The Normal Heart and new works by new artists.

intel.title: Suspects on the loose after killing a man near an elementary track meet
intel.content: A man was fatally shot near an elementary track meet in Washington, D.C., just steps away from the former Spingarn High School where the District of Columbia Interscholastic Athletic Association was hosting its elementary school track and field championships. The incident occurred around 2 p.m. and led to an urgent manhunt for the suspects. The suspects left the area in a car, which was later found burned in the Fort Lincoln neighborhood. No arrests have been made. The FBI and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives are assisting in the investigation. All students and parents were safe and accounted for, and the track meet was cancelled.
intel.summary: A man was killed near a Washington D.C track meet, prompting a major manhunt and nearby alerting schools to safety.

intel.title: Measles alert after Shakira’s MetLife concert
intel.content: Measles has made a significant comeback at the Shakira concert in New Jersey, causing a major public health alert after one out-of-state concertgoer was diagnosed with the virus. The New Jersey Department of Health is warning everyone who attended the concert between 7:30 p.m. and 1 a.m., including those who were not vaccinated, to keep an eye out for symptoms until June 6. The measles spreads rapidly, with one infected person's droplets hanging in the air for up to two hours. If you're unvaccinated, there's about a 90% chance you'll catch it if you're exposed. The MMR vaccine (measles, mumps, rubella) is considered the best defense, being 97% effective after two doses. However, with more people skipping or delaying vaccines, outbreaks are becoming more prevalent.

intel.title: LA County Supervisor Barger Leads Wildfire Recovery Roundtable In Washington
intel.content: Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors Chair Kathryn Barger led a bipartisan congressional roundtable discussion on wildfire disaster recovery in Washington, D.C. The meeting, hosted by Representatives Judy Chu and Brad Sherman, and Senator Alex Padilla, brought together federal lawmakers, Los Angeles County leadership, and disaster recovery experts. The roundtable highlighted the urgent need for federal support following devastating fires across California. The discussion also addressed ongoing recovery efforts, housing displacement challenges, infrastructure rebuilding needs, and federal partnerships for future disasters. Participants emphasized the need for robust federal engagement and resources. The event was also highlighted by a personal account from Los Angeles county Firefighter-Paramedic Ronnie Evans who shared his experience fighting to save his childhood home during the fires.
intel.summary: Los Angeles County Supervisor Kathryn Barger led a bipartisan congressional roundtable on wildfire disaster recovery, emphasizing the urgent need for federal support and collaboration to prevent future disasters.

intel.title: Donald DeNoyelles Obituary - The Journal News
intel.content: Donald DeNoyelles, a life member of the American Legion and the Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, passed away peacefully at Nyack Hospital on May 20, 2025 after a short battle with cancer. Born in 1936 in Central Nyack, he was married to Carole Anne Carpentier in 1964 and served in the U.S. Army from 1959 to 1961. He also served as an Operating Engineer for Local 825 International Union of Operating Engineers in Springfield, NJ. DeNyelles was also a 68-year life member and a member of The Benevolent & Protective Order Of Elks. He is survived by three daughters, Diane Nawoschik and husband Rob, Jane Anderson, Carolyn Freedman, and Thomas Anderson.
intel.summary: Donald DeNoyelles, aged 88, passed away peacefully at Nyack Hospital after battling cancer, a life member of the American Legion, and a significant historical figure.

intel.title: Traffic Alert: Four nights of multiple lane closures start Tuesday on I-95 for North Avenue bridge replacement
intel.content: The New York State Thruway Authority has announced that the North Avenue bridge replacement project over the New England Thrueway (I-95) in New Rochelle is progressing. intel.title: Cortland OKs parking lot lease - 607 News Now
intel.content: Cortland, New York, has approved a lease to a parking lot behind the old VFW building on Main Street, worth up to $20,000 for one year. All members of Cortland’s Common Council voted in favor of the agreement. The lease is worth $10,000 per year.

intel.title: Usha Vance Outshines Melania Trump Yet Again—With Classic Looks and Quiet Confidence
intel.content: At the Senate Spouses Luncheon on May 21, Usha Vance outshined Melania Trump with a bold ensemble. At the event, the first lady was the keynote speaker and stressed the importance of encouraging young people. Trump wore an ivory woolen jacket by Dolce & Gabbana with a high-waisted pencil skirt by the same brand and a chocolate-colored designer blouse underneath the jacket. Despite this, Vance's bold ensemble had a significant impact. She also opted for a cobalt blue dress by Badgley Mischka and an off-the-shoulder style. This marks the second time Vance has outdone Trump in terms of style during a luncheon.
intel.summary: Usha Vance outshowed Melania Trump in bold, coordinating outfits at the Senate Spouses Luncheon, contrasting Trump's ivory affair and FLOTUS's choice of traditional-looking outfits.

intel.title: Gunman kills 2 Israeli embassy staffers just 2km from White House
intel.content: Israeli embassy staffers Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Lynn Milgrim were killed outside the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington DC, just 2km from the White House. The suspect, identified as 30-year-old Elias Rodriguez from Chicago, was chanting "Free Palestine" when he was arrested. The victims were committed to building bridges between Arabs and Jews in an effort to prevent bloodshed in West Asia. Israeli embassies around the world immediately increased security. The shooting is expected to cause tension in the US between supporters of Israel and pro-Palestinian demonstrators.
intel.summary: A lone gunman, Elias Rodriguez from Chicago, killed two Israeli embassy staffers near the White House, sparking international condemnation of antisemitism and incitement.

intel.title: Jericho Cares holds inaugural cocktail fundraiser - Jericho News Journal
intel.content: Jericho Cares held its first cocktail party fundraiser on April 30 at the Muttontown Club. The event honoree was honored by Nassau County Legislature Deputy Minority Leader Drucker, who congratulated Jericho Cares founder Fran O'Connor for their support and partnering with the organization. The charity was launched in 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic and has since provided basic supplies and services for local families within a 20-mile radius of Jericho. Deputy Minority leader Drucker also celebrated the organization's designation as a charity partner for 2024-25.
intel.summary: Jericho Cares held its inaugural cocktail party at the Muttontown Club, celebrating its growth and partnership with local leaders, and securing a 2024-25 charity partner.

intel.title: Sad News for MLB World as Orioles Respected Veteran Passes Away at 89
intel.content: Jim Henneman, a respected veteran of the Baltimore Orioles baseball team, has passed away at the age of 89. He was the primary official scorekeeper for the team for 23 years and worked closely with the franchise to keep them in the hunt for the playoffs. Hennemen was a fixture at Orioles games since the team's arrival in 1954 and was also the official scorer for the club for 23 consecutive years. He covered the team in The Baltimore Sun, among other outlets, and worked 23 years as the primary scorer at Camden Yards. Despite his absence from the press box, the Orioles have lost a significant archive of information.
intel.summary: Jim Henneman, a respected sports writer and official scorekeeper for the Baltimore Orioles, has died at 89, leaving a significant chapter in their history.

intel.title: The Southern Poverty Law Center finds seven hate groups in Mississippi in 2024
intel.content: The Southern Poverty Law Center has found seven hate groups in Mississippi in 2024, according to its report, "The Year in Hate and Extremism 2024". The report tracks the presence of hate and anti-government extremist groups across the country and trends related to these groups' presence. The most recent concerns stem from fears of a "white genocide" by some groups.
intel.summary: The Southern Poverty Law Center reports seven hate groups in Mississippi, one of which is affiliated with the "Patriot Front."

intel.content: The New York Times News Quiz, May 23, 2025. Joe Biden was diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer, which has spread to what part of his body. The Supreme Court rejected a plan to fund the nation's first religious charter school, a decision that led to a recusal of one justice. Two embassy staffers were fatally shot this week in Washington. intel.title: Trustees push for equity in Adelphi deal - Garden City News
intel.content: Garden City, Massachusetts, Mayor Edward Finneran has asked the trustees to postpone consideration of the annual parking fee agreement with Adelphi University, which would have included a $25,000 payment from the university in exchange for use of the village's parking lot at Community Park during the academic year. The Board of Trustees agreed to postpone approval until a new meeting between village officials and Adelph leadership can take place. Resident Robert Herz supported the delay, arguing that Adelps should not receive discounted access to municipal services. He also suggested that the village should make a stronger case for Adelpi to share more of the financial burden of supporting the village. The village plans to order another $3 million pumper this year and is looking into negotiating a fairer and more equitable deal.
intel.summary: Garden City trustees delayed approval of a parking fee agreement with Adelphi University, urging a more holistic and balanced discussion to ensure fair and adequate financial support for the village.

intel.title: KNAC.COM - News - LORNA SHORE Returns With New Album, 2025 Tour
intel.content: Lorna SHORE is set to return in 2025 with a new album, I Feel The Everblack Festering Within Me, set for release on September 12 via Century Media Records. The first single "Oblivion" has been released, with vocalist Will Ramos describing it as a more evolved version of what LORNA SHORE truly is. The album will be accompanied by a new tour featuring bands including THE BLACK DAHLIA MURDER, SHADOW OF INTENT and PEELINGFLESH. The release of their fifth album, the first in three years since 2022's Pain Remains, continues their impressive career.
intel.summary: LORNA SHORE will release their new album I Feel The Everblack Festering Within Me on September 12, with a new tour and merch line.

intel.title: Funeral services set for Baltimore City firefighter who died after medical emergency
intel.content: Funeral services for Baltimore City firefighter Lt. Mark Dranbauer Jr. will be held on Saturday after he died following a medical emergency while responding to a fire on May 12. Dranabauer, a 23-year veteran of the department, fell from a ladder 40 to 50 feet off the ground and was taken to Shock Trauma, where he was initially listed in critical condition. He was put on life support and later removed from life support on May 18. After donating his organs, Dranabbauer was transferred from Shock Traum to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner. A viewing for Dranibauer will be conducted Friday at Schimunek Funeral Home in Bel Air and a funeral service will be the following day at Mountain Christian Church in Joppa.
intel.summary: The funeral of Baltimore City firefighter Lt. Mark Dranbauer Jr. will be held Saturday after he died following a medical emergency while responding to a fire on a ladder.

intel.title: Preview: NY City vs. Chicago Fire - prediction, team news
intel.content: New York City FC and the Chicago Fire are set to play in the opening match of MLS, with two teams separated by two points in the Eastern Conference standings. The match follows a 2-0 victory over the New York Red Bulls, which moved NYCFC up to seventh in the East, two places above the Fire who beat Charlotte FC 4-1. New York CityFC has won seven consecutive games against the Fire, and could extend their unbeaten run to three matches, marking their longest without losing since Pascal Jansen took over. Chicago, however, are on a five-match unbeaten run and have never beaten NYCFC on the road.
intel.summary: New York City FC and Chicago Fire face off at Yankee Stadium, with both teams leading the Eastern Conference standings;

intel.title: NBC 10 News wins Regional Edward R. Murrow Awards for bridge coverage, overall excellence
intel.content: The Radio Television Digital News Association (RTDNA) has announced that NBC 10 News has won two Regional Edward R. Murrow Awards, including for its coverage of the Commuter Crisis caused by the closure of the westbound Washington Bridge. The RTDNA also recognized NBC 10 for Overall Excellence in 2024, which coincided with WJAR's 75th anniversary. The winners are automatically entered into the running for the national Murrow Award, which will be announced in August.
intel.summary: NBC 10 News won the Regional Edward R. Murrow Awards for its coverage of the Washington Bridge closure and overall Excellence in 2024.

intel.title: TRAFFIC ALERT: Road closures expected in DC area for Memorial Day celebrations
intel.content: On Memorial Day, May 26, in the D.C. area, motorists may need to anticipate road closures due to Memorial Day celebrations in Washington, DC. Metrorail will open at 7 a.m. and close at midnight, while Metrobus will operate on a Sunday schedule. The National Memorial Day Parade will take place in the District of Columbia, with several streets closed for public safety and the parade assembly. The city of Falls Church is also hosting a Memorial Day parade and festival, with parts of the route being closed for parking. Normal weekday fares will be in effect on the holiday.
intel.summary: Road closures in Washington DC will continue for Memorial Day, with multiple events including the Beyer 3k Fun Run and Metrobus closures, while normal weekday fares remain normal.

intel.title: City orders emergency demolition after partial building collapse in Corona – QNS
intel.content: The city of New York has ordered the full demolition of a structurally unsound building in Corona following a partial collapse that endangered residents of a neighboring home. The FDNY responded to a 911 call reporting a building collapse at 101-01 37th Ave. No one was injured in the incident, but four residents in an adjoining home were evacuated. The Department of Buildings (DOB) had been investigating the site after learning of unsafe construction practices and found that a two-story structure with a cellar had been severely compromised due to unsafe construction. An emergency demolition order was issued on May 15 and required the installation of protective measures to protect pedestrians and neighboring properties. Full demolition operations began on May 19.
intel.summary: The city of Corona ordered the full demolition of a structurally unsound building after a partial collapse, resulting in four evacuations and safety concerns.

intel.title: Tom Mayenknecht: Leafs and Knicks are big brands with small success
intel.content: The New York Knicks and Toronto Maple Leafs, two of the leading heritage brands in their respective sports, have had a similar trajectory over the past 50 years. Both franchises have been associated with the historical roots of the two leagues they have been playing in. The Knicks and the Leafs represent two of North America's four largest sport markets, with the Knicks playing in the biggest media market in the U.S. and the Maple Leafs at Scotiabank Arena, the largest naming rights deal in the world ($40 million per annum and $800 million over 20 years). Both teams have been at or near the top of Forbes franchise valuation lists since 1998. However, both franchises have failed to consistently perform well in basketball operations on the court and in hockey operations.
intel.summary: The New York Knicks and Toronto Maple Leafs, despite their recent successes, remain iconic brands with strong commercial appeal and enduring success.

Both franchises have represented two of North America's four largest sport markets and play out of two busy arenas. The Knicks and the Leafs have been at or near the top of Forbes franchise valuation lists since 1998, with New York driving an estimated $543 million in annual revenues while the Leafs reportedly grossed more than $308 million US last year. However, both franchises have not consistently achieved success in basketball operations on the court and in hockey operations. This past week, the Knicks advanced to the eastern conference finals against the Indiana Pacers, their last Stanley Cup victory was in 1967.
intel.summary: The New York Knicks and Toronto Maple Leafs, despite their recent successes, remain iconic brands in basketball and hockey despite inconsistent results.

intel.title: Paul F Sylvester Obituary - The News-Press
intel.content: Paul F. Sylvester, born in 1936 in Jamaica, Queens, New York, passed away on May 15, 2025 in Cape Coral, Florida. Born in 1936, Paul was the son of Imelda (née Bellavance) and Frederick R. Syvester. He studied at Iona College and Saint John School of Law in Queens, where he gained lifelong friendships and worked with major corporations such as Johnson & Johnson, Loft Candy, and Mobil Chemical before transitioning into entrepreneurship. He also had a deep love for animals, particularly dogs, and a love for flying. Despite his divorce from his wife, Carmen, in 1993, Paul remained friends and will be remembered forever. A funeral Mass will be held at Saint Andrew Catholic Church on May 30th at 11 a.m.
intel.summary: Paul F. Sylvester, aged 88, passed away in Cape Coral, Florida, with a passionate love for animals and aviation, leaving a significant legacy.

intel.title: Bowser promises emergency bill to expand D.C. youth curfew
intel.content: D.C. Mayor Muriel E. Bowser (D) has announced that she will propose emergency legislation to expand the city's juvenile curfew hours. The curfew currently begins at midnight on weekends and ends at 11 p.m. on weekdays. The announcement comes after several nights of violence involving teenagers in the Wharf and Navy Yard neighborhoods. The Wharf, a luxury development in Southwest Washington, has also implemented a curfew for Memorial Day weekend, which bans unaccompanied minors from 5 pm. to 5 a.m., and requires anyone under 18 to be with a parent, guardian or adult 21 or older during curfew. Police Chief Pamela A. Smith stated that violators will be taken to the city’s Youth Services Center and if no one picks them up, they will be transferred to the Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services. Critics argue that curfews can reduce foot traffic and distract officers from other vital tasks.
intel.summary: D.C.B.O.S.W.D.E.B., proposes expanding the juvenile curfew, following recent violent incidents, aiming to reduce crime but effectiveness in other cities.

intel.title: Stanley Friedman Obituary - The News Journal
intel.content: Stanley Friedman, a resident of Washington, NC, passed away on May 19, 2025 at his home. The funeral will be held at the First Methodist Church in Washington on May 27, 2025, with officiated by Rev. Ken Hall, Rev. Stephen Bazan and Rabbi Rose. Burial will take place at the National Memorial Cemetery in Quantico, Virginia on May 29, 2025. Online condolences may be addressed to the family by Paul Funeral Home & Crematory of Washington.
intel.summary: Stanley Friedman, age 85, died at his home in Washington, NC, with his funeral set for Tuesday, 27, at the First Methodist Church.

intel.title: Upcoming Summer Programs & Events in Fredericksburg - Potomac Local News
intel.content: The Fredericksburg Parks and Recreation Department is planning a full summer schedule of activities for all ages and interests. From live music and lunch in the park to evening kayak tours and family-friendly summer camps, the city is offering activities for families and visitors. Callie Brown, Superintendent of Recreation, highlighted the upcoming events on the Potomac Local Live podcast. The city is also offering guided kayak experiences at Mott’s Run Reservoir, where all gear is provided. The Dorey Buffett Pool at Dixon Park will open to the public on May 25 for free, while non-residents pay a small daily fee. Summer camps begin on May 28 and run through mid-August, with options for children as young as 3 and special "grand camps" for grandparents and grandchildren.
intel.summary: Fredericksburg Parks and Recreation Department is launching summer activities, including free summer camps, kayak tours, and community events, to celebrate the unofficial start of summer.

intel.title: Baltimore, MD – Man Injured in Car Crash on 3000 E Federal St
intel.content: A man was injured in a car crash on E Federal Street in Baltimore, Maryland, on Thursday afternoon. The accident occurred near a residential and mixed-use stretch of E Federal St, an area where traffic congestion and narrow lanes can cause collisions. The injured man was transported to a nearby hospital for medical treatment. The extent of his injuries was not disclosed, but he was conscious and receiving treatment. No other individuals were reported injured in the incident. The cause of the crash has not been released, and Baltimore Police are investigating whether speed, distraction, or roadway conditions may have played a role. Local Accident Reports provides timely information, recovery resources, and guidance to help victims recover.
intel.summary: A man was injured in a car crash on E Federal Street in Baltimore, prompting a police investigation into possible speed and distraction factors.

intel.title: New York Weather Alert: Gusty Winds and Summer Sun for Sunday Travel on I-95, Memorial Day Storm Risk Ahead
intel.content: New York City will be largely sunny with strong winds and mostly sunny conditions Sunday, but rain chances are expected to increase midweek. The National Weather Service has issued a weather alert for New York City, with a high of 66°F and a low of 69°F expected for Memorial Day Monday with a 30% chance of showers, but temperatures will remain above 70°F. Rain chances will increase overnight into Wednesday, with up to 40% likelihood of showers and highs cooling slightly to the upper 60s. Meanwhile, expect brief clearing and sun returning by Friday, with temperatures expected to rebound to 73°F by Friday. Travel warnings may be issued if storm development increases.
intel.summary: Gusty winds and sunny skies on New York's sunny Sunday offer a brief preview to summertime, but rain chances increase midweek, with potential for severe weather.

intel.title: Virginia Weather Alert: Showers Move Into Annandale by Sunday Night With Heavier Rain Expected Tuesday Evening
intel.content: The National Weather Service has issued a weather alert for Annandale, Virginia, with rain expected early next week, with mostly sunny skies expected across the greater Fairfax County area and a high near 71°F. However, by Sunday night, there is a 30% chance of showers developing after sunset, leading to a 40% of showers after 2 p.m., which will increase to an 80% chance by Tuesday evening. The potential for rain could impact roadways during late evening commutes, causing slower traffic, reduced visibility, and potential ponding on secondary roads. Showers are expected for Thursday and Friday, with temperatures reaching near 66°F and persistent rain throughout the week. The weather pattern shifts from spring-like clarity to a wetter start of summer.
intel.summary: By Tuesday evening, heavy rain is expected in Northern Virginia, with heavy rain and persistent rain expected, impacting traffic and road conditions early next week.

intel.title: Good News on this Day in History - May 24
intel.content: The Brooklyn Bridge was opened by President President Chester A. Arthur and NY Governor Grover Cleveland in 1883, when it was the longest suspension bridge in the world with a main span of 1,595.5 feet. The bridge's construction took 13 years and involved about 2,500 men, mostly men, with no deaths. The project cost around $500 million, with the bonds sold to fund it being paid back until after the Second World War. David Bowie's concept album, Diamond Dogs, was released 51 years ago and reached number one in the UK and number five in the US. The Eurovision Song Contest, the longest-running international televised music competition, was held in 1974.
intel.summary: The Brooklyn Bridge was opened 142 years ago, making it the longest suspension bridge in the world, and David Bowie's debut album, Diamond Dogs, charted globally.

intel.title: Orioles press box namesake Jim Henneman, a longtime official scorer and beat writer, dies at 89 - Medicine Hat News
intel.content: Jim Henneman, the longtime Baltimore Orioles beat writer and official scorer and the namesake of the press box at Camden Yards, has died at 89. Hennman was a fixture at Orioles games since the team moved from St. Louis in 1954 and covered the team for decades as a newspaper reporter. He was the primary official scorer for their home games from 1997-2019 and was named in his honor before the 2024 season. He also served as the public relations director for the NBA's Baltimore Bullets from 1968-73. The Orioles’ press box was named before the 2025 season.
intel.summary: Jim Henneman, a longtime Baltimore Orioles beat writer and official scorer, has died at 89; the Orioles’ press box was named after him.

intel.title: Arlington Local
intel.content: The National Average Gas Price for Memorial Day will be $3.08 per gallon on Memorial Day, making it the cheapest at the pump since 2021, according to a new report. Road closures are expected in the D.C. area for the long weekend in honor of Memorial Day celebrations. Homeowners are unhappy with Frederick County Public Schools' options to prevent foul baseballs from damaging homes, which have been criticized by homeowners. The police are set to release body-worn camera footage from an officer-involved shooting that left two officers injured and the suspect dead. A vigil was held outside the White House for two Israeli embassy employees killed in a shooting. A young boy recovering from a traumatic injury was reunited with first responders who saved his life after a lawnmower accident. Travelers may have to consider leaving DCA for last-minute flights out of DCA due to potential flight disruptions.
intel.summary: A selection of notable stories from across the DC area, including a Memorial Day road closure and criticism of a foul baseball pitch safety strategy, as gas prices drop below $3.08 per gallon.

intel.title: Memorial Day events in and around Grundy County
intel.content: The Grundy Veterans Assistance Commission has highlighted several Memorial Day events in Grundry County, including a parade and observance at 10 a.m. at Minooka American Legion Post 1188. The Abraham Lincoln National Cemetery will also have an observance. The first large observance was held at Arlington National Cemetery in 1868, and Memorial Day was expanded after World War I to honor those who died in American wars. It was declared a national holiday by Congress in 1971 and placed on the last Monday in May.
intel.summary: Grundy County Memorial Day events include parades, vigils, and memorials, while the Abraham Lincoln National Cemetery hosts events to celebrate the holiday's history and national holiday.

intel.title: President Donald Trump is set to give the commencement address to West Point graduates
intel.content: President Donald Trump is set to deliver his first military commencement address since returning to office. The Republican president will address West Point's graduating class on Saturday morning. This follows his previous commencement address in 2020 during the height of the COVID-19 pandemic. He urged the graduating cadets to never forget the soldiers who fought a war over slavery during his remarks, and also paid tribute to the military academy's history and its graduates. Earlier this month, he addressed the University of Alabama's graduating classes, mixed standard commencement fare with political attacks against his predecessor Joe Biden and statements about the 2020 election. Vice-president JD Vance also addressed the graduating class at the US Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland.
intel.summary: President Donald Trump will address West Point's graduating class, emphasizing the military academy's history and current missions, during his first military address since returning to office.

intel.title: Leesburg police seek identities of men in malicious wounding case
intel.content: The Leesburg Police Department is seeking the public's assistance in identifying two men involved in a malicious wounding incident on May 18. The incident occurred at 2:18 a.m. following reports of a large fight in a parking lot. A man was found unconscious with significant head and face injuries. Police have released photos of the two persons of interest in the case. If you know these individuals, contact the Criminal Investigations Division at 703-771-4500 or anonymously at (703) 443-TIPS (8477).
intel.summary: Leesburg police are seeking the identities of two men in connection with a malicious wounding incident on May 18.

intel.title: Performing Arts News: The Center for the Arts at George Mason University Announces Full Lineup for 2025-26 Season
intel.content: The Center for the Arts at George Mason University has announced its 2025–26 season, featuring music, dance, theater, and more as part of Great Performances at Mason and the Family Series. Highlights include a performance by cellist Yo-Yo Ma with the Fairfax Symphony Orchestra in December, and Darren Criss, who will headline the annual ARTS By George! benefit event in September. The season announcement event was led by Rick Davis, Dean of the University College of Visual and Performing Arts. Season subscriptions are currently on sale for Friends of the Center for The Arts at cfa.gmu.
intel.summary: The Center for the Arts at George Mason University announced its 2025-26 season, featuring notable performances like Yo-Yo Ma, Darren Criss, and other notable artists, with season subscriptions available.

intel.title: Top 10 stories of the day: Hawks arrest suspect threatening Ramaphosa
intel.content: A 28-year-old suspect has been arrested in Gauteng for threatening to President Cyril Ramaphosa. The suspect was led away handcuffed by the Hawks’ Crime Against The State (CATS) unit. This follows a case reported earlier this month. Communications and Digital Technologies Minister Solly Malatsi has been summoned to a briefing by Communications portfolio committee chairperson Khusela Diko on the recently published policy directive that could allow the Starlink satellite internet service to operate in the country. President Cyrill Ramaphos said the issues raised by his US counterpart, Donald Trump, will be addressed in due course. The South African Police Service (Saps) in Galteng has seized counterfeit goods worth over R20 million during a multidisciplinary takedown operation. KZN police are searching for two criminals linked to murders in the province.
intel.summary: The Hawks arrested a 28-year-old for threatening President Cyril Ramaphosa, while Solly Malatsi discussed the Starlink internet policy in the US.

intel.title: Los Angeles Dodgers Make Last-Minute Emergency Roster Move After Exhausted Bullpen - LAFB Network
intel.content: The Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the New York Mets in 13 innings, despite a lengthy rain delay and a 3-run Mets ninth inning to send the game to extras. The team used eight pitchers throughout the game, resulting in 14 pitchers on the injured list. The Dodgers had to make a last-minute emergency roster move, bringing up Bobby Miller to the active roster. Miller, who was set to start for the Dodgers' Triple-A affiliate, Oklahoma City, has struggled this season but is expected to provide a fresh arm in the bullpen.
intel.summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers made an emergency roster move to bolster their bullpen after a heavy rain delay and 14 pitchers on the injured list.

intel.title: 052525-news-cemetery 1.jpg
intel.content: Patrick Prendergast, a caretaker at Pikes Peak National Cemetery, began his shift by lowering the American Flag to one-third mast on May 21, 2025. PrenderGast was a member of the U.S. Air Force Honor Guard at Arlington National Cemetery from 2009 to 2012. Today, he cares for veterans at their final resting spot.
intel.summary: Caretaker Patrick Prendergast lowers the American Flag at Pikes Peak National Cemetery to one-third mast, celebrating his service from Arlington National Cemetery.

intel.title: One Trapped in Late-Night Mechanicsville Crash, Medevac Requested
intel.content: One person was airlifted to a trauma center following a serious vehicle crash in Mechanicsville, Maryland, on May 23, 2025, following a reported motor vehicle collision with entrapment. The accident left one person trapped inside the vehicle, leaving him trapped inside. Local rescue crews were able to extricate the trapped occupant and transfer him to EMS for emergency care. The cause of the crash remains under investigation. No updates have been released on the condition of the victims.
intel.summary: A person was airlifted to hospital after a serious crash in Mechanicsville, Md, on Saturday night, requiring a medevac.

intel.title: NYC subway security guard caught holding emergency gate open for fare beaters canned
intel.content: Romuald Zampou, a private security guard hired by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) and contracted by Allied Universal Security Services, has been fired for holding the emergency gate open for farebeaters at a subway station. Zampo, who was caught by The Post holding the doors open for a stream of scofflaws, claimed his hands were tied and that he was unable to stop the scofflaws. Private guards have been stationed throughout the subway system as part of the MTA’s contract with Allied, the world's largest private security service provider, to deter fare evasion. The MTA has been struggling to collect billions in fares and has implemented rescue programs to balance its books.
intel.summary: A private security guard caught holding an emergency gate for farebeaters on New York subway was fired by Allied Universal Security Services pending an investigation.

intel.title: Impact of Trump’s visit to Capitol Hill
intel.content: The House Republicans have passed their multi-trillion-dollar tax breaks package, defeating critics within their own party by a narrow 215 to 214 to 1. The bill was passed by Speaker Mike Johnson, who also defied skeptics within his own party. Professor Casey Burgat from George Washington University discusses the impact of President Donald Trump's visit to the Capitol this week to secure passage of the bill. He also discusses how the impact on the bill will be felt by the public.
intel.summary: House Republicans passed a massive tax break package despite President Donald Trump's visit, despite opposition from within his party.

intel.title: Mets 5, Dodgers 2: Good news and bad news following huge win against L.A.
intel.content: The New York Mets won 5-2 against the Los Angeles Dodgers, marking a significant turnaround from a 13-inning defeat. The victory, which included a double and a walk-in, was seen as a sign of hope for the team. Juan Soto's performance was particularly notable as he broke his slump with a decisive fourth-inning double. David Peterson also performed well, giving up just two runs in the second inning and an ERA of 2.79. Brett Baty, another promising young player, has also contributed significantly to the win, contributing to the team's overall performance. The win, which tied the series with the Dodgers, is seen as crucial for the future of the Mets.
intel.summary: The New York Mets rebounded from a 13-inning loss to the Dodgers with a 5-2 win, highlighted by key performances from Juan Soto and David Peterson.

intel.title: Police investigating after 3 found shot in Southeast DC
intel.content: D.C. police are investigating after three people were shot in Southeast DC late Friday night. The Metropolitan Police Department responded to a call for the shooting just after 10:20 p.m. in the 4200 block of 4th St., SE. At the scene, three men were found shot, with two of them unconscious and not breathing. The third man was breathing and awake when officers arrived. The police are now looking for a black vehicle with tinted windows in connection with the shooting. No arrests have been made and no updates have been released on the victims.
intel.summary: D.C. police are investigating after three men were shot near Hendley Elementary School in Southeast DC, with no arrests reported.

intel.title: 2025 Maryland baseball state championships
intel.content: The Maryland baseball state championships were held at Prince George’s Stadium in Bowie, Maryland. In 3A and 4A, No. 1 seeded Sherwood defeated No. 3 seeded Chopticon 8-3 in 3A, marking Sherwood's fourth championship in five years. In 4A: Walter Johnson defeated Walter Johnson 7-6 by a late-game walk-off in the seventh, with Shaun Rudick's final high school at-bat securing the win for his team.
intel.summary: The Maryland baseball state championships ended in dramatic fashion, with Sherwood defeating Chopticon 8-3 to win 3A; Walter Johnson vs. Urbana win 7-6.

intel.title: 5 years since George Floyd murder, Black lives still matter
intel.content: The Black Lives Matter movement took over five years after the murder of African American man George Floyd, who was stopped by police in Minneapolis. The murder sparked protests all over the world, with demonstrations in Brazil and Colombia particularly popular. The US government has dismissed several lawsuits against police departments in several US states and ended investigations into police violence after Floyd's murder. Despite initial hopes that the protests would lead to positive change, only 27% of respondents believe the lives of Black people would improve, while 72% see no improvement. The Mapping of Police Violence project suggests that the police killed at least 1,260 people in the US in any year over the past decade. Amnesty International reports that in many countries, Black people are 2.8 times more likely to be killed by police people than white people.
intel.summary: The Black Lives Matter movement grew global after the murder of George Floyd, inspiring protests and calls for systemic reforms in police violence.
